Sentencas: This is the second part of a study of a novel Sr-Ca-Ni-Y-B silicate sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure

Sentencas: Part I of the study addresses the effect of NiO on glass forming, thermal, and mechanical properties, and is presented in the preceding paper.
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure

Sentencas: In this paper (part II), candidate composite glass with 10 vol.% NiO was tested for sealing standard coupons of Ni/YSZ anode-supported YSZ electrolyte bilayer and metallic interconnect Crofer22APU at various temperatures.
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure

Sentencas: Samples sealed at the highest temperature (1050 degrees C) showed hermetic seal after fully reduction and 10 thermal cycles.
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure

Sentencas: The interfacial microstructure characterization showed no distinct reactions at the interfaces of glass/YSZ or glass/metal, though some segregation of Ni was found along the glass/metal interface.
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure
Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure

Sentencas: Overall the composite glass with 10 vol.% NiO appeared to be a good candidate for SOFC sealing.
Titulo: Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure
Novel alkaline earth silicate sealing glass for SOFC - Part II. Sealing and interfacial microstructure
